claim: cold , cold heart be the only song from hank williams
resp:
#### Step 1: Identify the claim to be evaluated
The claim to be evaluated is: "cold , cold heart be the only song from hank williams"

#### Step 2: Find the relevant information in the table about Hank Williams' songs
To determine if this claim is true, we need to find out how many songs are listed as being written by or originally released by Hank Williams.

- Column name: "writer (s)"
- We need to check the rows where the writer(s) include "Hank Williams" or just "hank williams".

#### Step 3: Find all relevant cells for the claim
We will list each row that contains a song written by or originally released by Hank Williams:

Row 1: Track 1, Song Title: why baby why, Writer (s): darrell edwards , george jones, original artist: george jones, doesn't match.
Row 2: Track 2, Song Title: the pain of loving you, Writer (s): dolly parton , porter wagoner, original artist: porter wagoner & dolly parton, doesn't match.
Row 3: Track 3, Song Title: he thinks i still care, Writer (s): dickey lee, original artist: george jones, doesn't match.
Row 4: Track 4, Song Title: sleepless nights (featuring vince gill ), Writer (s): boudleaux bryant , felice bryant, original artist: everly brothers, doesn't match.
Row 5: Track 5, Song Title: crazy arms, Writer (s): ralph mooney , chuck seals, original artist: ray price, doesn't match.
Row 6: Track 6, Song Title: there stands the glass, Writer (s): audrey greisham , russ hull , mary jean shurtz, original artist: webb pierce, doesn't match.
Row 7: Track 7, Song Title: that 's all it took (featuring jedd hughes ), Writer (s): darrell edwards , carlos grier , jones, original artist: george jones & gene pitney, doesn't match.
Row 8: Track 8, Song Title: color of the blues, Writer (s): jones , lawton williams, original artist: george jones, matches.
Row 9: Track 9, Song Title: i forgot more than you'll ever know, Writer (s): cecil null, original artist: the davis sisters, doesn't match.
Row 10: Track 10, Song Title: next in line, Writer (s): wayne kemp , curtis wayne, original artist: conway twitty, doesn't match.
Row 11: Track 11, Song Title: don't let me cross over, Writer (s): penny jay, original artist: carl butler and pearl, doesn't match.
Row 12: Track 12, Song Title: please help me i'm falling, Writer (s): hal blair , don robertson, original artist: hank locklin, matches.
Row 13: Track 13, Song Title: there goes my everything, Writer (s): dallas frazier, original artist: jack greene, doesn't match.
Row 14: Track 14, Song Title: cold , cold heart, Writer (s): hank williams, matches.

#### Step 4: Evaluate the claim
Since "cold, cold heart" is one of two songs listed as being written by or originally released by Hank Williams and there are other songs not written by him, the statement "cold , cold heart be the only song from hank williams" is false.

claim: sleepless night (featuring vince gill ) be the song with the second longest length
resp:
### Step 1: Identify the length of each song
To determine if "Sleepless Nights (featuring Vince Gill)" is the song with the second longest length, we first need to identify the lengths of all songs in the table.

### Step 2: Find the song with the longest length
From the table, we can see that "Color of the Blues" has a length of 3:06, which is longer than any other song. Therefore, it cannot be the song with the second longest length.

### Step 3: Find all songs except for "Color of the Blues"
Now we need to find all songs except for "Color of the Blues". From the table, these songs are:
- Track 1: why baby why - 2:18
- Track 2: The Pain of Loving You - 2:46

- Track 13: there goes my everything - 2:50
- Track 14: cold, cold heart - 2:53
- Track 15: we'll sweep out the ashes in the morning - 3:14
- Track 16: if teardrops were pennies - 2:38

### Step 4: Determine which of these songs is the second longest
From the lengths found above, we can see that the song with the second longest length is actually "I Forgot More Than You'll Ever Know" with a length of 3:30.
